intro: Ruellia multisetosa, commonly known as the hairy ruellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Ruellia multisetosa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
